page.title: 17 Rushden Fire Station
page.content: Rushden fire station is along Newton Road. The station consists of 12 men, and 3 fire engines. The men work shifts of 4 days on, 4 days off. Their weekly routine consists of cleaning the station and vehicles, fire drills and general maintenance on all vehicles and equipment. When an emergency call is made it is passed through Moulton where a V.D.U. is used to find the fire's location and inform the station. The protective clothing they use is of a waterproof, flameproof, material. Their steel lined boots protect them from falling debris. They also wear a yellow helmet made of plastic and cork. In late 1985 a new fire station will be opened in Washbrook Rd, the old one will be closed as it is too small to house the equipment needed to fight modern day fires.
